books.title: The Phantom of the Opera
books.author: Gaston Leroux
books.summary: A mysterious presence terrorizes the Paris Opera.

books.title: The Just Men of Cordova
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: The Four Just Men travel to Spain to bring justice to criminals operating in aristocratic high finance.

books.title: The Diary
books.author: Samuel Pepys
books.summary: The diary of a man living in London in the 17th century.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Pollyanna
books.author: Eleanor H. Porter
books.summary: An orphan’s unrelenting optimism sees her through adversity and lifts up her new community.

books.title: The Conscious Lovers
books.author: Richard Steele
books.summary: A rich young man tries to avoid the marriage his father has arranged.

books.title: The Cherry Orchard
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A heavily indebted landowner and her family return to Russia in an attempt to save her estate from being auctioned off.

books.title: The Warlord of Mars
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: John Carter, an Earth-man transported to Mars, must rescue his beloved princess from imprisonment in the Martian Temple of the Sun.

books.title: The Council of Justice
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: The Four Just Men match wits with the Red Hundred, an anarchist group bent on raising havoc in Britain.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: A collection of nine short fiction works by influential supernatural and horror author Arthur Machen.

books.title: The Life of Buffalo Bill
books.author: William F. Cody
books.summary: The 1879 autobiography of William F. Cody, more commonly known as Buffalo Bill, detailing his early life in the American West.

books.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries, culminating in a life-or-death struggle with an evil nemesis.

books.title: The Rough Riders
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: The First United States Volunteer Cavalry fights in the Spanish–American War.

books.title: The Consolation of Philosophy
books.author: Boethius
books.summary: A Roman statesman awaiting execution is visited by the personification of philosophy.

books.title: Nonsense Books
books.author: Edward Lear
books.summary: A collection of literary nonsense in the forms of limericks, songs, and short stories.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: At the Earth’s Core
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: Two explorers burrow deep into the planet’s crust and emerge in a savage land inside a hollow Earth, where they have many adventures.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Ivan Bunin
books.summary: A collection of Ivan Bunin’s translated short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Kingdom of God Is Within You
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Tolstoy describes true Christianity as a non-hierarchical, nonviolent, non-coercive pursuit, and criticizes institutional Christianity as a deceptive corruption.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.
